text: There is a lovely sense of authenticity to the world and characters that make Wish Dragon up and especially for those with children, this is an easy recommendation!
So, is Wish Dragon a rip-off of Aladdin? The answer is yes, it undeniably is. But does that mean its a bad movie? Not really.
An endearing modern retelling of Aladdin, Wish Dragon ticks all of the boxes for a memorable family film - adventure, comedy, and sincerity.

Writer-director Chris Applehans, best known for his animation work on everything from Coraline to The Princess and the Frog and Wonder Park, has crafted a charming, contemporary and surprisingly emotional Chinese spin on Aladdin.

What Wish Dragon lacks in storytelling innovation, it makes up for with lively, vibrant CG animation that paints contemporary China in pleasant shades of pink and purple, much like the enchanted shape-shifting dragon at the center of its action.
I feel so indifferent about this whole thing... I forgot it as soon as I saw it.
It's a pretty shameless ripoff of Aladdin.
Is it as bad as The Emoji Movie? No. It's light years ahead of any of the Hotel Transylvania sequels. But it's still a few inches short of a decent movie.
But while Wish Dragon rehashes quite a few familiar storylines from the Disney classic, it offers enough new elements to be entertaining and sweet.
Wish Dragon isn't terrible but I found it to be bland with slow pacing
"Wish Dragon" delivers a whole new world, a new fantastic point of view, and that's plenty.
Sure, the lowbrow gags and rote combat drags the film down, but in the moments where Appelhans breathes contemporary specifics into the story, Wish Dragon is a quirky, appealing ride.
The voice cast was fantastic, and the animation is different enough from what you would get in a Disney cartoon to get you away from worrying it's a rehash of Aladdin.
...the magenta deity houses plenty of lightness, lesson and laughter to be his own being - if you can keep up, that is.
Wish Dragon is definitely a rip-off of Aladdin. But it has enough fun, laughs and heart to make it an enjoyable one-off watch.
"Wish Dragon" is a transporting experience, but it's far from a whole new world.
The plot's routine only emphasizes that the whole of Wish Dragon is pretty rote, regardless of any comparisons we may be tempted to make.
There is enough freshness in the writing and direction to strengthen the emotional component. It deserved a fate better than Netflix for its hysterical humor and huge heart.
Wish Dragon's environment and time period helps shake things up, but it still feels unavoidably derivative.
Charming characters, attractive settings, and universal messages balance a familiar storyline inspired by the same Chinese fable as Aladdin in this enjoyable animated film.
